attributes.action: make local authority's management “officers” directly accountable to a councillor and to the people they represent
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
local authority's management “officers” should report directly to an elected member of the local council who is accountable to the electorate to enable local people and their councillors to have proper influence over the decisions of the local authority. 

Recent experiences of local government concerning poor planning decisions, the introduction of controlled parking zones and withdrawal or downgrading of services generally by utilising deliberately inadequate and poorly implemented consultation processes and biased complaints procedures, suggest council officers can hide behind a load of confusing and conflicting bureaucracy to inflict just about what they like on the local population with virtually no democratic control.
